author: BuenaJay
text: Came here recently after a few years after my last visit. I can say that the quality of service, food, and atmosphere has been very consistent. Came in to watch the Mets game and the NBA finals and the atmosphere was fun and electric.

author: Denis Borisenkov
text: There is one place in Queens that has really caught my eye: the prices are pleasing to the eye, and the food is excellent. It is also a paradise for sports fans - there is a broadcast for every taste! The waitresses are charming, always ‚Ä¶

author: Jon Ramos
text: Had a great time at Hooters! We caught the NBA game on their big screens, and the atmosphere was perfect for sports fans. The wings were absolutely delicious, crispy, flavorful, and just the right amount of heat. Great service, cold drinks, and a fun vibe made it an awesome night out. Definitely coming back for the next game!

author: Kai Mendez
text: Honestly, this place is a hidden gem! A Mexican restaurant with the most beautiful touch: amazing Venezuelan people running it with so much love and kindness. From the moment you walk in, you feel like family. ‚Ä¶

text: The service was incredibleee and the food was really good! It has a lot of variety for such a small place‚Äîcozy atmosphere and reasonable prices right in the heart of Dumbo. A great spot to stop by for a drink! Thanks to all the staff who were very kind.

Solid Mexican food (get the enchiladas, they always hit the spot) good drinks, and damn good prices, especially for the overpriced Dumbo. The fact that it's steps from the subway so I don't have to drive after so many margaritas is a bonus.

author: Rune M√•nsson

author: ReedH
text: I absolutely loved the atmosphere at this place which feels like a rustic hunting lodge. The food leans new American and everything I had was pretty tasty. The star for me went to the grilled octopus appetizer with Manila clams that was ‚Ä¶

text: really awesome space hidden in the end of an active and free nyc museum, just absolutely beautiful decor inside that‚Äôs very warm and inviting. the food is really good and the staff are super attentive. great space for parties with plenty of space and options to enjoy a night with friends

author: Becky F
text:
This place is a gem! Rustic and cozy.

Wonderful ambiance and excellent service by Antonio, our server, and CJ, the ‚Ä¶

text: Although I'm giving it 4 stars, I do believe if I go back, I'll change it to 5. The food was good, the atmosphere was great, and the service was ok. In their defense, they were getting ready for a wedding that was happening 1 and a half ‚Ä¶

text: Aurora is one of those rare gems that perfectly balances atmosphere, hospitality, and unforgettable cuisine. From the moment you walk in, you can feel the cool Brooklyn vibe. We stopped there before the Brooklyn horror fest for dinner. ‚Ä¶

text: Aurora Brooklyn is a gem! The ambiance is warm and inviting, perfect for a date night or special gathering. Every dish we tried was fresh and flavorful‚Äîespecially the pasta, which was outstanding. The staff is incredibly attentive and kind, ‚Ä¶

text: This is a hidden gem in Williamsburg. I really liked their outdoor seating. Not many places offer outdoor seating with a calm atmosphere. All of the appetizers we tried were amazing. The arancini is a must! The chocolate cake was really good as well.

author: Darice F
text: Can‚Äôt comment on the food but the cocktails were delicious. It‚Äôs a warm, dimly lit restaurant with romantic lighting. The garden looks beautiful for warm evenings although nobody was out there due to the excessive heat. Our server was ‚Ä¶

text: The food was good. The manager was so cool, the staff were awesome.  You can definitely enjoy Italian food with a twist. A dinner date and your partner will forever remember that night.

author: Davide Pasquali
text: food was amazing, felt like I was in Italy! Antonio and Francisco made our experience unforgettable! We can‚Äôt wait to go back!

author: Tara Daniel
text: They deliver on everything you could expect out of a 24 hour diner. I was able to order breakfast for late dinner and it was hot and tasty. I should call out that my French toast was made exactly how I like it. Perfection. And my shake was ‚Ä¶

text: Very nice service from Javier. The food was great. I had a corned beef Reuben. And the coffee was also very good. I got a free coffee refill. Overall it hit the spot. I wish I would've tried the key lime pie but I was stuffed.

text: We were staying at the New Yorker for a night and ate here before a concert. The Chipotle chicken bowl was nice and big but had zero Chipotle flavor. It was like a salad with chicken tossed in mayo. Chipotle has a smoky flavor...... the ‚Ä¶

author: Kimberly Clarke
text:
This is our second morning eating here and it has been superb.
Michael is and awesome waiter and person.
The food is delicious and well cooked, flavourful and fresh. ‚Ä¶

author: Mike Cellucci
text: These are low key the best pancakes Ive ever had, just because of the full blown bananas they put on, usually its lil sliced bananas. We also had a fine dinner here last night. Its a lovely place to eat.

author: JD
text: Diner was clean and our servers were attentive. The mac & cheese balls were a cheap knockoff in comparison to The Cheesecake Factory's version. The pastrami burger was okay. Large portion. The bread held together well. Pastrami was sliced ‚Ä¶

text:
Our experience started off slow as we needed to
ask the waiter for some menus and there was some slight miscommunication in our order. However, once food came, we noticed the high quality italian food, well prepared and delicious.

text: The portion is crazy (in a good way if you eat a lot?), the flavor's not the best and to be honest it's overpriced. Besides, you don't get a lot of sunlight because of the setting of the restaurant, but the servers are super polite and attentive! That alone made my experience much better.

author: R Palmer (RTPalms)
text: This is a gem. The food is fresh and excellent and the staff is always gracious. We go as often as we're able!

author: Karen Roth Ingber
text: The food was solid.  I had the halibut special with lemon, capers and white wine sauce.  Fish was fresh and cooked perfectly.  Shared the Octopus appetizer with my husband.  It was very tasty.  Wine was good too.  Our waiter was very ‚Ä¶

text: Me my mother and sister were hungry and hot and were looking for an Italian restaurant.  This one looked interesting,  it was pretty,  cold and calm  (only one table was busy, rest of it was empty) we have been asked if we are for a dinner ‚Ä¶

author: Catherine Goodwin
text: This wonderful neighborhood restaurant is right around the corner from The Met and Guggenheim. Our lunch was lovely, with salads and seafood appetizers and then fresh pasta choices for the main course. The sauces were imaginative and full ‚Ä¶

author: J Parker
text: Had lunch after a Met visit. Everything we had was delicious. Pastas, veal, asparagus app, all beautifully presented and flavorful. Our waiter was very gracious and gave us travel tips in Italy (one of us is planning a trip in the fall). Prix fixe lunch is a bargain. Wonderful, would highly recommend.

author: John Brosens
text: I completely understand the desire to have a well dressed clientele and respect any rules a restaurant might have.  Giovanni requires a neat dress, nothing more and with my wife recently having surgery on her foot, sneakers were far more ‚Ä¶

text: I ordered the special, a truffle dish. I had noticed one on the standard menu and thought this version sounded. The price was @$24.00. When I got the bill, my very small portion of pasta was $85.00! I was shocked and asked the waiter who said he was not obliged to tell me the price before ordering! I feel robbed.

author: Ari Barak
text: We tried this place because it it was close to The Met and was the only place available with a day-of reservation for 9 on father's day. Looking back, it was easy to see why. The restaurant wasn't particularly busy, as only 3 other tables ‚Ä¶

text: I tried to walk in at Red Hook Tavern to try their famous burgers, but there was no luck getting a table. After searching on Google for nearby burger spots in Red Hook, I found The Good Fork Pub ‚Äî and it did not disappoint. ‚Ä¶

text: This place never disappoints. The food is always good; the staff is always friendly and the ambiance is always welcoming and relaxed. Recommend the smash burger; the kimchi and phili steak sandwich; the fries ( any of them ) and the Ceasars salad. Honestly you can't go wrong with anything offvthe menu.

author: Chelsea
text:
Food was delicious!! Drinks were great.. we tried a little bit of everything. Fried chicken  and Brussels were my favorite..&& The Fries were perfectly crisp.
Everyone was super friendly, amazing service. ‚Ä¶

author: Logan Shield
text:
5 stars
I stumbled into The Good Fork Pub while exploring Red Hook, and it ended up being the highlight of my day. There‚Äôs something about this place that just feels ‚Ä¶

text: One of my favorite places in Brooklyn. Great cocktails and beers. Live music on weekends in the gorgeous garden. And the food is GREAT. A really homey place.

author: Dave Davidson
text: Im gonna be honest, this was awful in so many ways. I ordered a ‚Äúsmash burger‚Äù and got what was frozen patties on a soggy bun. Not smashed at all, somehow light gray on the top and bottom, burnt on the edges, and raw in the middle. Fries ‚Ä¶

text: Popped into this place spontaneously around 2 pm on a Sunday. Self-seating with plenty of tables inside and out. Scan a QR code at the table to order. Food came out fast, and we loved it: Brussels sprouts, fries, Caesar salad, hot dog, ‚Ä¶

text: Great vibe and good drinks. I ordered the fish and chips but it was exceedingly disappointing for a high-ish price. It was a panko coated fish filet with fingerling potatoes. Just simply not what fish and chips classically is, and there was ‚Ä¶

text: A must visit! Delicious food, and high quality live music in a pretty outside seating area.

text: Loved this Pub.  I can't rate the food because I didn't eat anything.  The bartender, Barry and the server, Sam, were great.  The price for drinks is very good.  The space is lovely.  The indoors starts with the bar and you can see the ‚Ä¶

text: The fact that I hesitated adding this place. You know there is something when my values shakeee (or I shut up). It felt like such a special oasis. The lil street getting there felt like greenpoint but closer. The main room has such a ‚Ä¶

text: Finally made it here after wanting to go for years. A bit out of the way but worth the effort. I had brunch so can't judge all of the food but the food we had was far above the standard brunch fare in nyc. Delicious French omelet with a ‚Ä¶

text: Loved Diner! The old school diner setting is so cool - down to the miniature bathroom and the slanted ceiling. Cocktails were on point, food was delicious, and service friendly. Def recommend!

author: Alicia Llorens
text: Elevated diner experience. And best burger and fries, and Bloody Mary, ever. It‚Äôs become a monthly ritual of mine. Great atmosphere for brunch as well as for dinner.

text: Always a 10/10 meal for us, and our favorite local restaurant. Can‚Äôt go wrong with the burger, but they always have amazing seasonal dishes.

text: One of the most memorable dinners I have had in Williamsburg, thanks to both the food and the incredible service. Our waiter Benjamin set the tone right away. He came to the table, unrolled white paper, and literally wrote out the menu for ‚Ä¶

text: Takes a long time to dine here because the server comes over and personally tells you the entire menu and writes it on the table. Appreciate the personal touch but it does take a while. ‚Ä¶

author: Norhan Bassiouny
text: Came for dinner. Food was very good. One of the best Caesar salads. Burger was great and fries were cooked perfectly. ‚Ä¶

author: Aaron Weber
text: This is one of my favorite spots in Brooklyn and it‚Äôs great for a date night/special occasion. The staff is very friendly and yes, a member of the team will come over and walk you through the menu for the evening. This is because they ‚Ä¶

text:
I‚Äôve been coming to Dannee Thai for close to 7 years, and I have only compliments.
I‚Äôm moving out and this restaurant is what I‚Äôll miss most not being in this ‚Ä¶

text:
Absolutely one of the best Thai spots in New York!
Dannee Thai is an absolute gem ‚Äî everything from the cozy atmosphere to the rich, authentic flavors makes this place feel like a true taste of Thailand. The ‚Ä¶

text: Had green curry lunch with squid. It was enjoyable. A tiny bit spicy that I was mildly sweeting -- maybe also it was just being a hot day üòÑ the spring roll wasn't as I had expected though. Was expecting it to be the fresh kind not the fried ‚Ä¶

author: Heart Beatter
text: I ordered mixed seafood drunken noodles. I had to stop eating to write this review. Just wanna say ‚Äúthis is it!!‚Äù

text: A very lovely restaurant in Brooklyn. The decor here is cool. Decorated with old album covers of vintage jazz and seventies R&B.  The green curry was a bit too rich for me but everything else was great. Great prices, great service.  They have a huge takeout business as well. Nonstop couriers here.

text: i  had a meeting with my friend who studies at Pratt Institute. She recommended that i try Danee Thai. This was my first time dining here and i  really enjoyed it. The food tasted great and i especially liked Pad See-ew. I asked them to  make  it spicy for me. This restaurant will definitely be our meeting spot next time.

author: Jiaxin Liu
text: Always a great experience when I visit, the service is great. The food is hot and fresh. It‚Äôs comforting when I come here especially after a late night at school

author: Annika Northland
text: Been ordering from Dannee Thai for years and it‚Äôs absolutely the best. Our go to takeout spot, consistently good food no matter what you order, everything is so good and fresh

author: Ashley Wildman
text: Really tasty Thai food with generous sized portions and excellent service. I‚Äôve been to Thailand many many times and this place is pretty damn close to what you find there. Green curry and drunken noodle is strongly recommended.

author: Christina Dixon
text:
Such a great spot!

The ambiance is amazing. Plenty of warm lighting, comfortable seating, and ‚Ä¶

The staff were fantastic, so lovely and efficient. I came for a low key birthday meal (4 people) and it was perfect.

author: Josh
text:
Cash only!

A no-nonsense place to get a solid slice of pizza or a whole pie. I enjoyed the ‚Ä¶

text: Bought a few slices of pepperoni and combo. The pepperoni was a good sized slice covered in pepperoni. Add some pepper flakes and this tastes great for a late night bite. Pepperoni is their most popular and they get purchased as soon as ‚Ä¶

author: Kosta Rica
text:
Excellent NYC pizza!   We got in pretty quickly. Cash only. And the ATM right by the entrance - $3.50 fee.    $5 slice of regular.
Better off buying.a whole pie.

author: Deborah
text: We got a slice with pepperoni for 5.50 each (this seemed a little expensive‚Ä¶). The pizza slice was good and big but extremely greasy. text: The pizza was excellent‚Äîlight, flavorful, and not greasy at all. It was served at a good temperature (though I wouldn‚Äôt have minded it being a touch hotter). The dough was perfectly thin, with just the right texture, and you can really tell ‚Ä¶

text: The pizza was excellent‚Äîlight, flavorful, and not greasy at all. It was served at a good temperature and counter crew was super friendly too . The dough was perfectly thin, with just the right texture. Overall, a great spot.

author: Alan Ritchie
text: I thought that this pizza slice was good but not exceptional given all of the hype and praise it receives in the media. It is cash only as a heads up and the workers weren‚Äôt the most welcoming. I would have liked the slice just a bit ‚Ä¶

text: Pros: Lovely place, the sushi is delicious, they have solid happy hour deals and interesting specials on offer. ‚Ä¶

author: Ashly Tepi Jimenez
text: I was really looking forward to enjoying some sushi, but unfortunately, the experience didn‚Äôt quite meet expectations. While the food especially the Califlower dish was absolutely delicious, the service was slow. We received our appetizers ‚Ä¶

author: E √Üngel-Rose
text:
I have been coming here since they opened. Consistent, fresh, and earthy Japanese food with a great energy and staff.
Always a good go too at any time of the year. ‚Ä¶

text: This restaurant is Japanese owned and the sushi is excellent. My very picky Japanese family came to visit NYC and literally said ‚Äúthis fish is one of the highest quality fish I‚Äôve had in the US‚Äù so it‚Äôs legit. This restaurant is going to be ‚Ä¶

text: Excellent Japanese restaurant! Conveniently located near the Morgan Avenue L train station. Atmosphere is cozy with three long tables occupying the dining room, making dining with big groups easy and the experience of dining next to ‚Ä¶

text: Delicious. Highly recommend! I'm gonna come here for the fries or cauliflower bites alone ‚ù§Ô∏è the sushi and hiroshima Yaki were delicious as well. I can't wait to be back!

author: Olivia N
text:
Overall rating: 5

I will travel to bushwick just for this sushi. SO FRESH. SO SO GOOD. I have nothing else to say because it was literally so fresh. Highly recommend!

text: Dropped in for an impromptu date night and it was perfect! Service was attentive, food came fast, and everything was delicious. I loved the kitade doko mushroom roll, hubby loved the ume kyu which has crispies! The seaweed salad was also ‚Ä¶

text: We visited here as part of an organised vegan tour of Brooklyn. Momo was amazing. We had a selection of vegan sushi and dumplings and they were soooo tasty! Service was fantastic with the waiter singing about each plate of food as he put it down on our table.  Was one of the highlights of the tour.

author: Manikandan
text: Lombardi‚Äôs Pizza in Nolita delivers that classic New York slice experience with a cozy, old-school charm. The coal-fired crust has a perfect char, the sauce is tangy and balanced, and the mozzarella ties everything together beautifully. Fun ‚Ä¶

author: Greg White
text: Hate to be that guy but... while it may be first, it definitely isn't best. Pizza was 3/10 for me. Also got the pesto pasta dish... very bland 2/10. ‚Ä¶

author: Amin Sameni
text: Established in 1905, Historic pizzeria with charming, old-school vibe and simple but tasty pizza ‚Ä¶

author: Hyden B
text: Stopped here on a whim and we were informed as soon as we entered that they only accept cash. Thankfully we‚Äôd be able to handle that, so we were seated. ‚Ä¶

author: ReedH
text: I‚Äôd been craving pizza for a while and finally decided to give Lombardi‚Äôs a try. I‚Äôd always skipped it, figuring it was more of a tourist spot with its claim of being the first pizzeria in the U.S. I ordered the double pepperoni though and ‚Ä¶

text: By far one of the best places we ate on our trip!  Lombardis definitely left a lasting impression on us and our palates!!  Delicious!!  ü§§ The cauliflower crust was amazing!  Not like the standard crust you buy in the grocery store.  And I ‚Ä¶

author: Sam Hernandez
text: Wonderful food! I ordered the aloo gobi, vegetable pakora, and onion bhaji. The soup they brought to the table prior to us ordering was absolutely mesmerizing. ‚Ä¶

author: Caitlyn Gray
text: We had an amazing experience dining here for lunch. Kunal was a great server! He was extremely attentive and accommodating. The food was extraordinary and you got so much of it for only $16 which is their lunch special. Comes with ‚Ä¶

text: A handful of interesting new flavors, and a whole lot of dishes you'll recognize. They have a robot bring your food, a crowd pleaser. The dishes are good sized. Try the palak paneer chicken Tikka, and the samosa chat, all were good. The ‚Ä¶

text:
Definitely a heavy hitter for the area.

The food was spiced well and deeply, although doesn't taste strictly ‚Ä¶

text:
The restaurant decor gave me the strangest idea, that I was walking on a giant crossword puzzle!!
Then suddenly!!  From  nowhere, a robot!!! ‚Ä¶

author: Nathaly Montanez
text: Delicious Indian food! To begin our meal we were offered a small cup of tomato soup, with cummin crisps on the side and sauces. The combination of flavors is wowing and super comforting. Appetizers were really good, samosas a bit too big ‚Ä¶

text: I've been here a few times.  Once during the all you can eat brunch for $9.99 and several times for dinner.  The brunch was well worth the money.  Food was great and lots to choose from.  For dinner I had the seafood moilee, which was ‚Ä¶

author: patrick lehman
text: The decor is really beautiful, and a fresh departure from the ‚ÄúChristmas lights all year‚Äù look of East Village Indian restaurants. author: Mkaurene
text: I absolutely love this restaurant! Everything moves pretty fast, I love Seinfeld and the food is incredibly tasty every time! Some characters work there, but most discrepancies are easily dealt with and are worth the food, 100%. Ive gotten ‚Ä¶

text: I had medium expectations, I thought it would just be a gimmick because it's the Seinfeld restaurant. But the food was awesome. I had a bacon omelette. The breakfast potatoes are bomb. It's a nice atmosphere and the service was great.

text: I had a late lunch here. I think many people come for the experience, as the exterior was used as the site of the restaurant in Seinfeld. It is a fun New York joint with people packed in and a lot of yelling. You really need to come and be ‚Ä¶

text:
One of the bucket list locations during my vacation due to Seinfeld.

text: Was visiting Columbia for a match and found this place nearby. I didnt know at first that it was famous but wanted a nice diner type meal. It was refreshing to be in a diner with a lot of great brunch options for a reasonable price. I ‚Ä¶

author: Blake
text: It's the place from Seinfeld. Just the exterior, not the interior shots. We had apple pie and cheesecake for a dessert. It was fun to stop by and see the place. They had some seinfeld posters and photos on the walls. There is a "Jerry's Salad" on the menu, aka The Big Salad.

text: Good takeout but I have had better. Not Gluten-free friendly. Flavors okay but have had much better. Crab Ragons were the highlight of the meal. Inside needs decor work.

author: Juan Pablo Daniel Borgna
text: Attention was outstanding. Katsu was great. I'll be back for sure.

author: Shelly Ann M.
text: Very large selection of food so you have a large variety to choose from depending on your mood. I think its considered asian fusion which explains their extensive menu. Their teriyaki shrimp and shrimp fried rice was really good.

text: Delicious food, great service. We would recommend, especially if you‚Äôre trying to eat in a quieter part of town.

author: NYC Guide
text:
Maria the server is always nice !
Fernando and George the owner work hard! ‚Ä¶

text: We had a yummy meal here on a Wednesday for lunch. They were just busy enough to feel lively and the waitstaff was attentive but not hovering. I had the Mexican bowl which was surprisingly tasty, and we also got pancakes and chicken fingers and fries. Everyone was full and happy!

text: The classic burger always hits the spot. Nicely cooked. Always really good fries - slightly crispy outside, tender inside. Had a chocolate shake this time. A bit more milk and less ice cream than I was expecting, but still quite tasty. We often have the pancakes, which are good.

author: Jennie Rivera
text: I gain satisfaction from having found this place. The food tastes perfect and portions fill you up. My favorite meal. The team's service enhanced our visit. The restaurant maintains clean surfaces and good energy. This spot surpasses its competition.

author: Juan Calderon

author: Jeffer Sonian
text: Best dinner on the upper west side. It‚Äôs large so you don‚Äôt have to wait long even on a Saturday brunch time.

author: Luis A
text: Great diner. The food is always fresh and delicious. They have the best eggs in town. Always get a side of sausage. It is amazing!!! Great coffee as well. The staff is friendly and very attentive. Great neighborhood diner.

author: Victoria Kozicki
text: Loved this place! Delicious food, lovely to have a burger and sushi at the same time. Wine was great and our server Eric was just a gem. Very friendly, efficient & knowledgeable. He was very accommodating for my friend‚Äôs food intolerance We will be returning and we WILL be asking for Eric again! :)

text: My sister always talk about how good their burgers are, so I finally got the chance to try it and I must say I enjoyed it. Our server was amazing and the atmosphere was clean. The food and drinks were really good.

text: Just a 6 star experience. Our server, Andres was the best and most helpful guy. Thanks for the amazing service. The portions were massive and the price was really fine for such amount of food. Bacon was delicious, patty was just as we ordered. Overall great food for a great price.

text: I have been to this NYC burger restaurant several times and it never disappoints... Amazing burgers, onion rings to die for and crispy crinkle fries. Love the decor and ambience too. I will for sure be back for my burger hit next time I'm in NYC.

text: I went by myself as always. When the host took me to the table there was cockroach on the napkin and she just asked me to wait and took it out in front of me and I ended up getting the same table. Didn‚Äôt say nothing but after that the ‚Ä¶

text:

A chic and unique wine bar featuring chocolate pairing.

author: Dr. Markus Klingenberg

author: AG

author: Joshua G
text:
Very opening atmosphere and seems very friendly. service is lovely they are very polite
And patient. The food is filling and great-tasting the perfect place for a nice breakfast

text: After a doctor's appointment, we wanted to eat breakfast. We google to find a place and this was the result. There was no wait time. The server was quick to serve coffee immediately. text: Honestly I will travel everytime from the Bronx to Harlem just for their pho! Me and my partner reviewed quite a few pho spots and Just pho you is definitely the right spot. Also the service is was great.! The owner makes sure everyone feels at home ‚ù§Ô∏è

author: Wandering Wanderer (Wandering Wanderer)
text: Tried the food on 2 separate occasions far apart, one takeout and the other dining in and both times the food made me sick. I don't know what it is but it just doesn't agree with me

text: How does 3+3+3= 1?  I will tell you. The ratings do not allow you to rate attitude and store good-will toward the community.  I had been a patron in this store on many occasions. This day I asked to use the bathroom.  I am a senior man and ‚Ä¶

text: It's a small little place. Quaint quiet calm are all the words that come to mind to describe the atmosphere of this restaurant. Staff is friendly and attentive. Food is a hit or miss. I ordered brisket, which was incredibly dry. I don't ‚Ä¶

text:
Update: 2.22.2024

text: I used to eat here on a weekly, biweekly basis. But I can tell when a place is ready to shutter and fold. The quality of the food has gone down terribly. The rotisserie was not delightful, it was distasteful and the presentation looked like ‚Ä¶

author: Nick Felker
text: I got the beef brisket when I arrived here on a quiet evening. The food comes with a few sides, making the whole meal very filling and tasty. It's good food.

text: I really enjoyed how I was welcomed as I enter the diner. I also wasn't sure about the wine and was allowed to sample two kinds. Jerry is very pleasant, patient and accommodating.  He made sure everything was up to par. The food is ‚Ä¶

text: Stopped in for lunch while in town visiting family. I had a delicious Cuban sandwich with fries. And my husband loved the pulled pork. Our son and my brother enjoyed breakfast options that also looked delicious. Very happy with portion ‚Ä¶

text: Classic American Diner with a 6-page menu. They got everything from breakfast to dinner and everything in between. The place is very cozy for a quality time with family/friends. Nice outdoor patio as well.

author: Peter Papastamatis
text:
Fantastic diner with tasty food and exceptional service!

The service was just exceptional, the food was fresh and tasty. ‚Ä¶

author: Monisha Bharij
text: The food is always good and the staff are very friendly and welcoming

author: Molly Hinesley

text: Had a late breakfast after a night partying. We were waited on by William, who was accommodating and pleasant. We had french toast, omelettes, and coffee. It was your typical diner food; it helped us sober up a little bit.

text: Sipsteria (UWS) - have you been here? I was looking for a sophisticated but reasonable happy hour venue with my husband and found this lovely place that has recently opened in our neighborhood. During the day they are a charming coffee shop ‚Ä¶

author: Davit Barblishvili

author: Janna Longacre
text: The food here is amazing‚Ä¶ very unique and authentic‚Ä¶. The wine list is excellent‚Ä¶ staff people will make great recommendations

author: Bella Fenn
text: Super cute spot! We've been to the Sipsteria in Morningside heights and like it but this one is even cuter. More restaurant style and less cafe vibes. We sat at the counter and drank coffee for a couple hours. The other half of the ‚Ä¶

author: Kayla Haley
text:
Stumbled on this hidden gem on the UWS!

author: Rebex
text: @ilgustowinebar is an authentic italian restaurant located on the upper west side! ‚Ä¶

text: Nice quiet spot for a good priced and tasty dinner. We came by with no reservation on a Saturday and were sat immediately. Very relaxing inside with a cute interior. Food was delicious and server was nice!

author: NYC Guide
text:
Great food and wine. Excellent service especially from Fida and Juan tonight.

Gus the owner has done a great job of making this restaurant classy steps away ‚Ä¶

text: Very solid happy hour deal. Not the best food in the world, but solid enough for the price point. Good drinks. Friendly staff

text:
I didn't love this.  And for the most part I can blame it on one main thing:  cheese.
I had two different items that were topped with cheese, and in both cases the ‚Ä¶

text: Great spot on the upper west side. The place had good food, wines and ambience. I thoroughly enjoyed my seafood magic, pulled with some Montepulciano! The dessert selection coupled with the port wine was a nice touch.

author: Victoria Lee
text: Delicious and fresh sushi! Shrimp tempura was especially crunchy and flavorful along with their crispy duck roll with mango sauce! ‚Ä¶

text: A typical Brooklyn restaurant experience. It took us more than 20 minutes to find a parking spot, but we eventually made it. The menu is extensive, offering plenty of options at fairly reasonable prices. The food portions were generous, ‚Ä¶

text: When I walked by this lovely little spot the day before on a little Brooklyn adventure and saw their cute patio that had so many folks seated with their pups, I knew I had to check it out! I came back a couple of days later for breakfast. ‚Ä¶

author: Lucy Bennett
text: First time trying this diner as the queue is always really long once 10am hits. Unfortunately I really disliked my food: scrambled eggs & bacon with 'house potatoes'. The eggs were almost inedible, flat and dry on the outside, slimy and ‚Ä¶

author: Jun Simons
text: Update: on a recent visit the servers seemed to ignore us for 30 mins before giving us a check even after we asked twice.  Strange for a pretty small restaurant! ‚Ä¶

author: Sunil Agarwal
text: Food was good but I wouldn't say it was exceptional. Portions were of a good size and the place was extremely busy on a sunny March end weekend. Service was a bit slow due to the crowds. It took quite some time before we could get someone ‚Ä¶

text: Unfortunately, most of the stuff we hot was either soggy or just very cold. The steaks were okay. The calamari was not crispy nor hot at all. All of our eggs were very average. I did love the fries though. Service was great and the vibe of the place is sweet. Overall, we were REALLY disappointed with the food.

author: Patricia Bernyer
text: Went on a wednesday late morning. Delicious eggs benedict, although i wished the potatoes had a little less veggies cause they were so good without. Finished it off with a pancake, i liked it! Amazing service and cute little patio. Would go back!

author: Sarah Scheaffer
text: The food was amazing! I ordered a turkey avacado tomato omelet and my friend got eggs Benedict with corned beef. The service was super prompt, polite, and accurate. The bathrooms are clean. The room we were in was very bright, natural light, and well decorated. They do have outdoor seating.

author: TheRareCoin
text: Had a fantastic experience! Classic Brooklyn diner charm with genuinely friendly service and truly delicious food.

author: Nani
text:
When I think of Clark's which I've gone to an abundance of times...I think of the amazingly fresh OJ and how there is always a wait.
Expect good food in a tightly squeezed location. ‚Ä¶

author: Moe Karsh
text: Dough is crispy, sauce is awesome, and just the right amount of cheese! Consistently delicious every time!

author: Jermaine
text: Absolutely amazing pizza with SO MANY tasty vegetarian options. I stumbled in while staying around the corner and im so grateful I did. I ended up stopping by everyday to pick up a slice or two during my stay. The space is tiny, better ‚Ä¶

author: Samii Stoloff
text: Really awful service. They prioritize online orders over people who are in the store. Had to leave to catch a bus after waiting an insane amount of time for a slice to be warmed up. Was the only person in line.

author: David Green
text: A good choice for a variety of pizza. Very small with about four 2 top tables inside and 3 on the sidewalk. As most NYC pizzerias, Sabas runs very smooth, the guys have it wired.

author: Shneur
text: Small pizza shop with few seating tables. Pizza, salads and sides for a fair price. I got the split pea soup, "small" 14 inch pizza, mixed fries and garlic knots. Pizza Pie and 2 toppings was $24. The pizza slice was large and had to fold ‚Ä¶

author: Mary R.
text: Such good pizza! I was able to try a little but of every slice and my favorite was the spinach and artichoke. I highly recommend.

author: Solomon Martin
text: No matter how many times I give them a second chance, always the same story. Order online, nothing shows up. Good pizza, extremely unreliable

author: Michele Guttermuth
text: Good late night snake. Nice size slices and fast delivery. Think they were running out of slices as it was the end of the night but overall very delicious. Small hole in the wall with a couple tables. Just Did a grab and run overall recommend

author: Lisa Calberg
text: Best pizza I‚Äôve ever had. Well seasoned sauce, and many vegetarian/kosher options. Guys are great!

author: Mg 0
text: Delicious, crisp, fresh, thin-crust pizza with a wonderful savory flavor in a tiny space. My veggie slice (~$5) had chopped broccoli, spinach, fresh mushrooms and, a welcome surprise, sliced green olives. These really brought it up a level. ‚Ä¶

author: Katherine Ng
text: West Side Wok is a small, no-frills sushi and poke spot tucked into a convenient corner of the Upper West Side, just steps from a major subway stop. While it‚Äôs not necessarily the kind of place for a long sit-down meal, its location makes ‚Ä¶

author: Fleur Touchard
text: One of our favorite delivery option! Fits the taste of the entire family. We are never disappointed and love to order there as much as we can. I love the chicken noodles soup and pad tai; they are my favorite!

author: Sam Hundstad
text: Great quick little corner restaurant! The service was so fast and friendly! Didn't have to ask for refills, or extra napkins and when the food came out they even moved tables to give us a bit more room! Now the food and drink were so ‚Ä¶

author: A.L. Harris
text: Great lunch special and excellent Thai food.  Generous portions and reasonably priced. Lunch includes an appetizer and main course with rice.  Thai Basil is one of the best I‚Äôve had.  Fresh vegetables and add chicken for only $14.50.  Delicious dumplings too.  Friendly service in this cozy Upper West Side neighborhood restaurant.

author: Paloma Frias
text: I had lunch with a group of 5, we ordered the appetizer platter and 5 different main menu dishes, including the comfort soup, the fried rice with shrimps, red curry, and some others which name i can't remember. Everything was deliciously, ‚Ä¶

text: My friend and I met up for lunch and we decided to go for Thai food. The host and server are super friendly and very attentive! The food was very well seasoned and delicious. The location is nice and open with charming details throughout the restaurant.

author: Jackie Whitaker
text: Stopped in here around 4pm on a Thursday. The inside is cute, sunny. Service was very polite, we ordered a couple of cocktails off of their happy hour menu which were very good and poured generously into cute glasses. The thai iced coffee ‚Ä¶

text: Amazing food.   Homemade Chicken Dumplings and Chiang Mai Soup.  Will be back again,  and again.

author: Kristina Paula-Schroeder
text: Beautiful experience. The food was absolutely delicious and the ladies working there are darling and so sweet. I‚Äôm so glad I stopped by!

text: Came by for lunch on a whim while walking through UWS and was very happy with the decision. The team was very kind and polite, the menu had great selection, and the happy hour drink menu was a treat! I ordered the Chicken Pad Thai and it ‚Ä¶

author: M E
text: Great atmosphere and fantastic restaurant! Enjoyed the Black Noodles with chicken. Delicious!

author: L. R.
text:
UPDATED REVIEW 2024:
While the food is still good and so is the service here. I will say that the lunch portion has been downsized a bit. I believe the prices have for the most part ‚Ä¶

text: This is some of the best Asian cuisine I‚Äôve had in a long time! Every dish we ordered was outstanding, as were the cocktails. I highly recommend it. My personal favorite was the street food-style Singapore noodles and black pepper prawns.

author: G√∂kay Zeren
text: Great small restaurant serving a diverse range of Southeast Asian cuisine. The appetizers were enjoyable, and the cocktails were well-crafted to complement the dishes. The food was delicious with generous portions. Highly recommended!

text:
An absolute 10/10 experience!

Absolutely loved this place!!

The food was packed with flavor - everything we tried was delicious, especially ‚Ä¶

text: My wife and I had lunch at Rudraks yesterday. Wonderful addition to the area.   Pleasant space. Great service. Delicious Indian food. Pappadums with three chutneys, along with naan bread, aromatic rice, ‚Äútoday‚Äôs daal‚Äù, desert ‚Äî all included ‚Ä¶

Mostly mediocre food with one inedible dish.

text: Pretty decent dim sum for the UWS. Spacious and very very kid friendly. There were plenty of families with their strollers and lots of high chairs. There‚Äôs an area in the back to park strollers or if you have a sleeping baby, you can park ‚Ä¶

text:

text: We looked for a good dim sum restaurant before going to the Natural History Museum and found one on Google. However, the food was not exceptional, and nothing really stood out. We have had better dim sum in other places. The service was decent, and so was the atmosphere.

text: Hold on to your chopsticks, folks, because my taste buds recently embarked on an adventure at RA Sushi! Brace yourselves for a review that's both humorous and tinged with a touch of disappointment. Let's dive right into the saucy details! ‚Ä¶

author: Joshua Harris
text: Great sushi! Some of the best I've had in a long time. Great options, quality ingredients, and friendly service. The tacos and sushi bowls are yummy too. But you need to get some sushi there. I would definitely go back!

author: G Frye
text: The Downtown Special rolls were great. We smelled the wonderful ocean as soon as we open the container. It‚Äôs more than enough for our family of five. And we have been order a lot from this place. However, once there was missing ginger and ‚Ä¶

text: Good service and nice interiors. The avocado sushi and the sweet potato roll was good. They served plum wine which is the sweetest one I have ever tried so far. Loved it .

text: Ordered through ubereats. The bags came wet with the Udon we had ordered, as it had lost its cover in transit and was all over the place. The Miso soup came in a paperboard cup whose bottom section had nearly dissolved, so it leaked. The ‚Ä¶

text: Really good sushi drinks and service. There is a plethora of menu options that you can choose from. The place is very clean and service is prompt. I personally loved the Samurai Sushi combo entree.

author: T S
text: I can‚Äôt believe I haven‚Äôt done a review for this place before! The food is so good with unique and interesting rolls and menu options. My absolute favorite go-to menu options are the lobster tacos and the ‚ÄúRa‚Äùckin roll! They never miss! I ‚Ä¶

text: I love coming to Haru Sushi UWS to soothe my sushi cravings from time to time. They have a really good happy hour menu! Great service, good sushi, beautiful presentation!

author: Blake Rasmussen
text: A real gem on the upper east side. The food is excellent - while we didn‚Äôt eat this trip we‚Äôve had the schnitzel in the past. The beers are special - czechvar is a very special, hard to find lager that only select bars will get. Glasses are ‚Ä¶

text: We heard about this restaurant on social media and had it saved on our to go list for a while. We had never had Czech food and they're the only Czech restaurant in Manhattan. So, we finally decided to take the 1 hour trip and try it out for ‚Ä¶

text: I'm giving this restaurant a top rating even though I barely ate anything - the person who made the reservation didn't know I was vegetarian. Nonetheless I had a great time, as I love experiencing cuisines that I've never been exposed to, ‚Ä¶

text: What a gem tucked away off the main drag. Im hesitant to even mention them because everything about the place is fantastic. Czech beer on tap, a huge menu with tons of great food. Top options from our visit were the duck confit, red ‚Ä¶

text: When I stepped into Bohemian Spirit, I felt like I had been teleported straight to the Czech Republic. The interior design is spot on and really captures the atmosphere. I ordered a Pilsner and wasn‚Äôt given water, which actually made me ‚Ä¶

text: Came here first time yesterday evening for diner. Glad I found this place! As someone from a similar culinary and cultural background ( Poland ) it is so hard to find good, Central European restaurants in the city. The interior of the ‚Ä¶

text: Since there‚Äôs no decent Hungarian restaurant in the city, I always appreciate other Central European cuisines. Food is great overall, some dishes can be a hit-and-miss.  Czech beer on tap, slightly grumpy service (adds to the authenticity), hot goulash soup (guly√°s for us) with fresh bread and I‚Äôm happy.

author: Andy Schwarz
text: This is a fun place, but dinner was hit and miss.  The duck confit with red cabbage was delicious, but the salmon disappointed.  Service was OK at best, and it was a nice dining experience.  We will probably not return, as the quality of the food was uneven.    I think this might be the perfect place for a beer and a bite.

author: Martina Ruseva
text: Amazing, very authentic food with generous portions (NJ suburbs sizes) üòÑ I loved the goulash and the palachinke dessert. Worth the trip if you are looking to experience authentic European cuisine ‚Ä¶

text: Yesterday I ate there with friends for the third time. My grandmother was Slovak, so I grew up familiar with a closely related cuisine. Bohemian Spirit is the real thing. Three of us had the Potato and Mushroom Soup, a generous bowl, rich, ‚Ä¶

author: James Johnson
text: We had just made it to town, were hungry, and didn't want to shop around for food. My wife and I dined here the last time we were in town and loved our meal. So, dining hear again was a no brainer.. Del Frisco's it is. ‚Ä¶

author: Jerryvan Rosado
text: Del Frisco‚Äôs offers the kind of classic steakhouse experience that lives up to its reputation. I visited for my birthday at the recommendation of my partner‚Äôs brother, and the evening was exceptional from start to finish. ‚Ä¶

author: Mansoor Almulla
text: Del Frisco‚Äôs Double Eagle in New York never disappoints. Every visit feels like a masterclass in how a true steakhouse should be run. The steaks are consistently outstanding‚Äîperfectly cooked to your preference, tender, and full of flavor. ‚Ä¶

author: Travis Freeman
text: This place has a pool table with enough space to play. That alone is worth the trip, but they also have a back area with  social/mixer vibes. Ffff I don‚Äôt even wanna tell people, ($5 beers is a good deal for me) bartender was polite; beer was ice cold and I‚Äôm glad I found this spot

author: Nia Gaillard (Mint)
text: Coming back to try the food. But I absolutely love their frozen espresso martini. The bartenders are absolutely incredible and nice . Beautiful bar and beautiful atmosphere. I‚Äôm so excited to visit again‚ù§Ô∏èüôèüèº ‚Ä¶

author: Jolie Valentin
text: This place prides itself on being open minded and inclusive. Really? I went in on a weekend night wearing my Magen David and was told by both employees and customers that I was in the wrong bar. So much for inclusion.

author: Tom F
text: Home bar for my Monday pool league. Great staff, great drinks at a good cash price, and plenty of options for events and dances that will satisfy your palate no matter who you are. From raves to theatre to billiards, this place will scratch your itch, guaranteed.

author: Leah V
text: I've been perfoming at and hosting at Parkside for years - I just started my own series there and it has been the most seamless of experiences working with Gavin (and Dex by extension!). I'm given freedom to curate the way I want and have ‚Ä¶

author: Mariette Papic
text: I have been a fan of Parkside for years. It's the last of the truly local bars in the Lower East Side. In the back room open mic events and art reign. In the front, the pool table and the photo booth are my faves. I know the owner (full ‚Ä¶

author: Sebastian Rosen
text: Just divorced my wife and came back to my favorite bar of all time. The bartender poured me a stiff one and asked me about my problems. A beautiful African American woman began twerking on me and I soon forgot my troubles. I love the park side lounge so much. May it live on forever.

author: Lauren Melissa Ellzey
text: I went to Parkside Lounge for a meetup in the back room. The acoustics were good, the live music was nice, the atmosphere was conducive to conversations with friends, and the drinks were decently priced. But it was just that: average. There was a 20 dollar minimum charge for cards.

author: Hilton Webb
text: Went here to listen to a friend Felix Guzman read his poetry and ending loving this little gem with two bars, pool table, performance stage and and all-day until 8pm Happy Hour. What more can you ask of a local watering hole. Too bad I live a $45 Uber ride away or I would come more often than I can.

author: Matthew S
text:
One of the last real dive bars in the LES.

Good beer selection, even better prices. Unpretentious and genuine. ‚Ä¶

author: Paige Amble
text: Excellent service as we felt welcomed and the staff took care of us. The inside was beautiful and made the ambiance great! Had great little appetizer at the beginning which included bread and salami and cheese. Order the special of the days ‚Ä¶

author: Albert Law
text: I really enjoy dining in the restaurant.  It is a great place to mingle with friends.  This is a very solid restaurant offering Italian food. Pasta and appetizer is nicely made. Like many restaurant the dessert can‚Äôt make me to give them a 5 stars.

author: Kundan Sen
text: Superb Italian restaurant within walking distance of Wall Street. Beautiful, expansive ambiance. Attentive and professional wait staff. The peppers added a level of spice to the usual bread table starters. Calamari and herbed potato wedges ‚Ä¶

author: Lynn Greco
text:
Lovely old school Italian restaurant.
Super nice staff, very attentive.
Menu had great variety plus many specials of the night. Not sure why it was ‚Ä¶

text: Ate dinner here with some family last night and the whole experience was incredible. Luigi our server was top notch and so was the rest of the staff. The food was delicious in every way. The quality and freshness of the meal was something ‚Ä¶

text:
Nice Italian restaurant, great service, cool ambiance, but the food is bland.
We tried different pasta dishes and I had a house special cavatelli with meat sauce and it didn't have athe taste I was looking for. T-bone steak was a little chewy for my taste as well. Over all an ok experience, just not the great one.

author: amit klobocishta
text: This establishment located between maiden lane and platt st on gold st has a very welcoming and warm environment perfect to escape from a busy world the food is something that you can‚Äôt find anywhere else in the city especially downtown. ‚Ä¶

author: V
text: Great service and food. Place has been around for a while and always wanted to try it. ‚Ä¶

text:

text: For just $13, you get a generous portion of food‚Äîdefinitely great value for the price. ‚Ä¶

text: Value Indian fast casual restaurant. Would eat here again! They take card or cash.

author: Ann
text: $10 for two curries, rice, and a naan is an incredible deal. They‚Äôll also give you some sliced onions and spicy peppers on the side. ‚Ä¶

text: Although generally a good establishment in terms of service, food quality, and taste, I was extremely disappointed by the quality and flavor of the biryani I had catered for a work event. They need to improve in this area. The chef needs to ‚Ä¶

text:
Really good lunch combo value for $12.

text: Stayed at this hotel in October, had a great experience. Beautiful room, huge, the shower and bath tub were amazing, and notable.The bar, the food, the people were great. ‚Ä¶

author: R3956HTangelat
text: Hotel was much nicer than expected. Raymond at the front desk was awesome. The room and bathroom were much larger and cleaner than expected. The shower is huge and has a powerful rainfall shower head which we loved. Also loved that the ‚Ä¶

text: I had a great experience at the Hyatt Centric Wall Street ‚Äî and even more exceptional service. I felt so very taken care of and everyone was so kind. Cassie at the front desk was a gem (she was so lovely) and Mamou one of the cleaning staff ‚Ä¶

author: Magyari Luca
text: I enjoyed my stay a lot here. The rooms are very luxurious and clean, and the food and drinks from the minibar were very delicious. My room had an awesome view. It is also surprisingly calm and quiet at night, considering that usually the "heartbeat" of New York is heard all the time.

author: durgakumarv
text: Our overall stay at Hyatt Centric Wall Street had both highlights and disappointments.||||On the positive side, the room itself was in excellent condition ‚Äî modern, comfortable, and very well maintained. Housekeeping deserves a special ‚Ä¶

author: Rahul N
text: We really enjoyed our weekend stay in June this year. The rooms were spacious, clean, and overall welcoming. text: Happy Hours was a nice experience.  After many years of passing by I finally got to try this place. The sangria and well drink was great as was their macaroni and cheese (with mushrooms and tomatoes).

text: I stopped in for a quick coffee and something to eat. I didn't know it was more of restaurant style setting but they were happy to seat me and I went with the cafe American and rice pudding with Blueberries. The food was just as good as the atmosphere.

author: Pete
text: charming staff serve thoughtfully-prepared good-to-high quality dishes.  simple, well-chosen wine list.

text:

Great food, lovely wines, friendly staff, nice ambience, and reasonable price tag. (Given it's NYC)
Highly recommended!!

text: Went there for a quick bite to eat and ate the Pad Thai - it didn't disappoint. It was definitely one of the better Pad Thais that I've had in my life. Good food, quick service.

Cooked well, ginger was evident, and the sauce was light, not syrupy.  I'd go back, especially if I'm staying at the nearby hotel again (across the street).

text: Sat outdoors and had a really enjoyable experience! The service was great for a busy Sunday brunch, I got the eggs Benedict with delicious poached eggs. The side potatoes were okay but I was pretty full from the rest of the meal.

They use organic ingredients which is a plus for us as we use organic at home. I had a Soco and my partner had a chicken sandwich. Review the photos below I promise you won‚Äôt regret eating here!

text: Perfect local diner. There's a reason they have been around since the late 70's. Food was excellent and service was friendly.  I wish we had a Waverlys back home in Phoenix.

author: Juan King
text: The restaurant runs with precision that's rare to find. Waverly Diner holds my loyalty through quality cuisine and employee service. They deliver taste and service without demanding excessive payment. You'll struggle to find comparable dishes around the city. I expect to return to this spot.

author: Jenny D (Citybird_Adventures)
text: Exactly what you‚Äôd expect from an old-school city diner. Classic feel and all the staple dishes.

author: Sunil Raja
text: Lovely authentic diner in a great location.  The food was perfect and the service was excellent.  Friendly & welcoming, kid friendly, good for couples, families or friends.  The waffles were nice and light.

author: Alba Tellez
text: I remember the food was soo good and the service so fast that I'm sorry I can't go every week. The coffee is served in normal cups, and the water in plastic ones. It is an small place but since they're so fast you will not wait long. The decorations are nice in special the tinted windows.

text: Margaritas are nothing special but tasty enough. Food is above average, but not memorable. Service was acceptable but not exceptional. Overall, if you're in the neighborhood, then sure, make a reservation. But I wouldn't make it a destination for good Mexican, but rather, just OK Mexican.

text: I LOVE this place. Drinks are really fantastic and every dish I have had is great. Highly recommend for brunch; I especially love the beef burrito and the omelette (pictured). text: Happy hour: very standard, modern Mexican offerings. I enjoyed a guava margarita, guacamole, and a fabulous dipping salsa for the fresh chips. For a decent price and nice atmosphere, this is a great Chelsea happy hour.

text: We knew this place would be good from reviews (decor doesn't give you that impression), but it surpassed our expectations. The salsa they give you was some of the best I've had, roasted veggies that tasted kinda creamy too, so good!! The ‚Ä¶

text: Enjoyed a great lunch there yesterday, great food and very warm staff. It was my first visit but certainly not my last. - Service: great, very attentive ‚Ä¶

text: We come here often, and it never disappoints.  The food is amazing, the service is fantastic.  The restaurant is spacious and welcoming. We‚Äôre never hurried thru our meals. There‚Äôs a bar area, outdoor seating and large inside dining areas. ‚Ä¶

author: Nicole Louie

text: Very nice atmosphere, a bit on the louder side, so conversations require a bit of effort. ‚Ä¶

Wow.

text: Still the best restaurant for Portuguese eats in the city, though you won't find much of the rustic quality of the cuisine in this Michelin Star menu. The seasoning needed to be stronger in the shrimp (none of the classic heat you'd expect from alhinho) and bacalhau, but nice overall.

text: I mean‚Ä¶. When in NYC you either want to try the best at all cost or try the cheaper version of it. In my case I wanted to keep it easy and local. This is a very reasonable classic American burger. Doesn‚Äôt pretend and it‚Äôs just well executed.

text: I loved my visit to Paul‚Äôs. This family-owned spot has some of the best burgers in NYC, and the customer service is exceptional. I tried the signature burger and the jalape√±o poppers, and it was juicy and packed with flavor. The staff made ‚Ä¶

I will go back for their gravy cheese fries - nostalgic. Next time i‚Äôll try their smash burger.

text:
Great shots, food AND CONVO

author: Gabriel Miranda
text: I didn‚Äôt have high expectations since there is no hype for this restaurant, but the food is really good, especially the octopus and the croquetas. Totally recommend them. ‚Ä¶

author: Marie Yang
text: The tapas here are just sublime! The choices of fresh seafood and meat combined with simple but layered flavors are truly unique. Will come back to try out all the dishes on the menu!

author: Jack Tuggle
text: I‚Äôll admit there may be slight bias in the fact that I think tapas these days in major cities are over priced based on the amount of food you get. ‚Ä¶

author: Cass
text:
Insanely delicious. Everything we tried was simply amazing. Aaaammazzzinngg. And the service was great.
Our favorites were: ‚Ä¶

author: Jonah Olsson
text: Wow. I actually forgot to take a photo of most of our dishes because it was so good. The food is superb and comes in a perfect size to share. Great wines too and top staff. Highly recommended.

author: Jae Young Park
text: Nice place with good tapa style dishes. They had five specials on the menu and we got a mackerel special. The shishito peppers were good but the white asparagus was a bit underwhelming. The wagyu steak dish and the shrimp risotto dish was also great. Good dessert as well. On the more pricier side so probably best for special occasions.

author: JASON R
text: Once I got past the hostess who came off sterile and acted annoyed. The GM took over and made things far more enjoyable. To be fair, I walked in by myself without a reservation, but how it was managed is another. My dinner was great, the service was also.

author: Digna Beasley
text: We found Txikito through the NYC 100 Best Restaurants list, and it truly deserves its spot. This Basque tapas restaurant is warm, intimate, and feels like a little European escape tucked right into the city. The ambiance is cozy, the ‚Ä¶

author: Maggie
text: This place was just‚Ä¶ all right. Nothing particularly special stood out to me, and I left feeling a bit underwhelmed. The fried shrimp was probably the highlight‚Äîcrispy, flavorful, and cooked just right‚Äîbut aside from that, the other dishes ‚Ä¶

author: Justin Broughton
text: Best food we have had in NYC. Tapas Basque style. Superb Potatoes and Padrino Peppers, Anchovies, Cochinillo and whole shrimp, but the highlight was the Bombs Rice with Shrimp, flavored with Uni. I cannot remember eating anything quite so heavenly.

author: Rachel Lander
text: Went here with a friend on a Thursday night. The food was excellent and the vibes were immaculate. There‚Äôs Vinyl DJ spinning records at the perfect volume to enjoy your meal while also feeling like you‚Äôre in Tel Aviv. I highly recommend the ‚Ä¶

author: Michelle
text: Cool dining experience. Thought there were some great dishes and some that were just exactly what you expect. I really liked the 4 spicy instruments, the bread salad, and the spicy moroccan chickpeas and chicken thighs. Got a few other ‚Ä¶

author: Omer
text: The experience was absolutely fantastic! The food came out at a perfect pace, paired beautifully with some amazing cocktails. The quality of the ingredients really stood out - everything was balanced, flavorful, and cooked just right. The ‚Ä¶

author: Shachar Ashkenazi
text:
Wonderful service and great atmosphere.
Some of the dishes we tried were phenomenal, while other dishes weren't too special. ‚Ä¶

author: Sofia Esguerra
text: Omg!!! I was sooo surprised by this place! Not only the food was AMAZING, but the whole vibe of the place was great (and I went there on a Monday)! I just can‚Äôt get over their vegetables, specially their amazing salad with tahini and their ‚Ä¶

author: leeheecarni
text: Had the best experience! The food was great and fresh, the service and the atmosphere were so accurate and fun. Definitely will come back

author: Lana Smith
text: We had the most amazing time at Port Sa‚Äôid!!! We came for a bachelorette party and it brought the vibes from start to finish. We had an amazing table right by the DJ and our server Gavin and all the staff were just 10/10. The food was super tasty and large portions. Was an amazing night out!

author: Ximena Del Cerro
text: I wouldn't go back. The place is awesome and the plating is impressive, but the all the dishes we ordered had a few similar ingredients (parmesan cheese, tomato sauce, cream) and lacked a punch. The highlight was the bread salad, but ‚Ä¶

text: This is popular spot for a lot of reasons. The space is beautiful, the staff is friendly and accommodating and the food is inventive, flavorful and well portioned. It would be a great spot for a large gathering or a small group but it may ‚Ä¶

text:
All very kind and excellent service. The food was delicious; bread salad, batata, ribeye skewer üç¢! üòã
And drinks as well, three made with excellent care. üíï ‚Ä¶

author: Mandoo Mul
text: Fantastic. Excellent service & food. Great staffs, respects their customers. We both ordered L.I. Burger w/bacon + scotch soda highball. ‚Ä¶

author: Hannah Bartch
text: Long Island Bar is perfection. The food hits that sweet spot of comforting but inventive, and the drinks flow so easy you lose track of the decade you‚Äôre in. Part of me doesn‚Äôt even want to write this because I don‚Äôt need TikTok mobs ‚Ä¶

author: Daniel French
text: Really busy local spot - can be a wait for table/bar space. The burger is excellent, well worth it (and starting to appear on some lists), the martinis are great too. Really friendly barstaff too

author: Daniel Oas
text: I love this place, I did not expect for the sushi rolls to be so big with so much fish! Also it is so amazing how they have a large variety of options. The pumpkin croquettes were great. Service and atmosphere is like a diner almost, but with Japanese features.

author: Han Chung
text: Fun spot with changing daily specials - their $8 obanzai is the main attraction. We had the pork shiokaji which was incredible, so smoky and just the right amount of fat. Their roasted veg dish and salmon tartare don were also delectable. ‚Ä¶

author: belkys c patino f
text: With the spectacular flavors of the East, exquisite sushi, as well as its desserts... beers... accompanied by excellent service

author: Cody Robbie Tran
text: This is the one and only Thai restaurant I keep coming back to in New York. I‚Äôve dined here twice, and each visit has left me deeply satisfied. In fact, it‚Äôs hands down the best Thai food I‚Äôve had in the city, no exaggeration. ‚Ä¶

author: Lindz
text: I have to do better with food captions; etc BUT the food was gooood and the service was FAST, we love that. Everyone was polite; only 4 stars for service because she asked me if I wanted dessert, I said yes the chocolate lava cake and then ‚Ä¶

author: leonardo Gulkok
text: Cozy atmosphere, and delicious food. Servers are polite and friendly. Our server was ‚ÄòBest‚Äô and she helped us to choose the meal we liked, so cute and friendly. We will be back soon for sure. Thank you for the great experience.

author: Bella Fenn
text: Super super yummy!! Stopped in around 5 pm on Friday without a reservation and were sat very quickly. Super cute restaurant, wonderful service, and the food is soooo good. We had the curry puffs and would 10/10 recommend.

author: Liran Tamam
text: The appetizers were excellent, especially the beautiful purple one which was almost too pretty to eat. The drunken noodle was absolutely phenomenal and everything we tried was delicious. The atmosphere had great energy but it was really ‚Ä¶

author: Ersegun Kocoglu
text: We had a wonderful dinner experience at Sala Thai. From the moment we arrived, Kamon welcomed us with such warmth and genuine kindness ‚Äî it immediately set the tone for the evening. ‚Ä¶

author: John Kevin
text: This is on my top list of Thai Restaurants in NYC. We loved everything we ordered. From the appetizer : Chicken Satay, the peanut sauce and the vinegar is so good, Pad Thai anf Pineapple Fried Rice is so flavorful and not salty at all. Thai ‚Ä¶

author: hm94133
text: What a great find on a rainy night in New York City!  We had the garden rolls, branzino and massamun curry - everything was delicious.  Our waiter, TK, was fantastic - super attentive,  friendly and helpful. We were amazed at how quickly our food came out.  Highly recommend!

author: Luis Martinez
text: I have been coming to Sala Thai since they first opened in 2018. I have visited also many of the Thai places in the area, Thai 72, Senn Thai & Land Thai among others however, Sala Thai has a more authentic flare with it‚Äôs decoration as well ‚Ä¶

author: Markanmak M
text: Great food and service. We tried their  Pad Thai Bolan And  Chilean Sea Bass. Both came out hot and delicious. Keep in mind that there might be a longer than usual wait time if you during their peak hours if you don‚Äôt have a reservation. ‚Ä¶

author: Kelly Punch
text: We had a wonderful experience. Our server was very nice and helpful. Drinks were pricy but really well crafted. Everything we ate was delicious.

author: Gabe Ross
text: Always my neighborhood go-to. The best sushi in the area by far. Always consistent, authentic, comfort food, fresh fish, a New York classic. Not stuffy like all the omakase spots popping up all over, but much more high end and elegant than ‚Ä¶

text: This place is so easy to miss..I‚Äôm actually not sure it has a sign out front. It probably does but I just went in without looking because my friends told me about it. Seems that that doesn‚Äôt slow down business. I went on a Thursday night an ‚Ä¶

author: Olga NYC
text: The Chicken Teriyaki was perfectly cooked‚Äîdefinitely among the best I‚Äôve had. The "Sushi Regular," with eight pieces of sushi and one tuna roll, was fresh and flavorful, though the wasabi inside was a bit unexpected. The seaweed salad was ‚Ä¶

author: Zo
text: Beautiful and delicate food, beautiful balanced flavours and authentic. Some of the most tender and tasty outside of Japan. ‚Ä¶

author: A R
text: We have dined at Sushi of Gari on the Upper West Side twice, once in the restaurant a long time ago, and then again for takeout tonight. The sushi has been great on both occasions. It's not my favorite Japanese in Manhattan, but along with ‚Ä¶

author: Steph W
text: *Okay granted this is partially our fault buttttt - we asked the waiter for a recommendation for sake. The waiter provided us 3 small samples to try but he did not offer to share the price of the bottle nor did we ask. When the bill came, ‚Ä¶

author: eric yao
text: After nearly 20 years, Gari remains one of our family‚Äôs favorite omakase places! The fresh fishes, their rice and unique sauces make Gari‚Äôs sushi among the best. Service is impeccable.

author: Amy Wapner
text: Being a very experienced Japanese food appreciator, we decided to start with a simple sushi deluxe dinner. !! And the quality of the fish, the RICE, and the iverall feeling was excellent! We will be back for omikase soon. Thanks so much.

author: Karl Brumback
text: Gari is open again after a long renovation ( to the building itself, not so much the restaurant). The space is actually smaller now as they lost a row of tables between the sushi bar and the windows; the big table is gone too. ‚Ä¶

author: Britt van der Poel
text: Who doesn‚Äôt love fresh noodles? This place is amazing. The spicy cucumber salad was so saucy and punchy. Sizzling noodles have a bite and are a bowl of comfort. Freshest ingredients. The open kitchen creates a wonderful atmosphere. The service is uniquely sensitive and attentive. Highly recommend!

author: Natalie
text: Food was delicious. We had the shrimp rolls, popcorn chicken and savory pancake scallions and they were delicious, especially the chicken. I had the beef noodle soup and it was so hearty, delicious and filling. Our waiter Galvin was great and guided us with recommendations. Will definitely be back!

author: Xintong Huang
text:
Great Sichuan spot just steps from Columbia! üè´
The Pea Pasted Noodles were rich, spicy, and super comforting ‚Äî perfect on a cold day. The Tang‚Äôs Fried Rice (with minced pork and preserved veggies) totally ‚Ä¶

author: Ann Sullivan
text: The Tang is a cozy, contemporary eatery serving creative Chinese noodles and other classic plates on the Upper West Side. It‚Äôs nice for a date or dinner with a friend. We had such a great meal from the Braised Beef Noodle Soup to the Zhong Dumplings and Tang‚Äôs Bliss Chicken Wings‚Ä¶ So delicious!!

author: nivesh vaze
text: Had a great time at The Tang NYC! The mango cocktail was super refreshing, and both the spicy chicken fry and kung pao chicken were packed with flavor and perfectly cooked. The crunchy potato wedges were dynamic and full of spicy flavor. Great food, fun vibe ‚Äî definitely worth a visit!

author: Chef John
text: I've had better noodles dishes out of packets. That Braised Beef noodle is dirty dish water, with star anise and bok choy. I had 2 bites, covered in chili oil, had another bit and it ended there. They still kept it on my bill too, which is really not ok. Im not about to get a slice at Mama Too because im hungry. The Tang.... the wang.

author: Kateryna Baranovych
text: The best service and food in the neighborhood. Recommend their noodle dishes and crispy spring rolls. Great and friendly staff, and nice atmosphere.

author: samridhi joshi
text: Tang in New York is hands down the best spot for contemporary noodles‚Äîperfect for a fun outing with friends or a cozy date night. The Chinese food is incredibly authentic and absolutely delicious! ‚Ä¶

author: Jingmin Xu
text: It tastes so good! All the noodles are delicious and I like the cabbage and the shrimp. But need to wait for the food since it‚Äôs cooked in front of you. Totally worth it!

author: Claire Camacho
text: I was seated easily on a Thursday night without a reservation. The food came out within 15 minutes, and the waiter was always refilling the water without me noticing. The Ma Jiang Mian was so good. Al dente noodles, creamy sauce, and fresh ‚Ä¶

text: Wow. This is the nastiest experience I‚Äôve ever had with a restaurant in my life. First, I ordered sesame chicken with pork fried rice, no onions. I could tell the guy taking my order was struggling to understand me and repeated myself a ‚Ä¶

Overheard in the bar, ‚ÄúYou know it‚Äôs a good Chinese food spot when it‚Äôs right next to the hood.‚Äù

text:
FACTS FOR REVIEW
Best boneless spare rib tips
& ‚Ä¶

text:
A roach in my food.
So sad because they lost a customer. That's sooooo disgusting.

text: Note this is not a szechuan or human restaurant. As such, I should have known not to order the szechuan wontons. They were not hot & spicy, they were soggy and inedible. If you've ordered these wontons anywhere else, you'll know what I mean. The beef chow fun was okay, very oily, and the noodles were very wide and stuck together.

text: I bought lunch special beef & broccoli lo mein, brown rice, shrimp toast and chicken noodle soup. The food wasn't bad at all but their rice and soup could use some more work.

author: Yeollie Peollie
text:
The tacos were incredibly juicy, and the Jamaica agua fresca was simply delicious. The ‚Äúchurros sandwich‚Äù was also exceptionally fresh and tasty!

author: Kevin
text: Steak tacos were decent. On the pricer side when it comes to tacos but overall was fine to taste and enjoy for a quick meal or dinner date in the area. Place feels more like dive bar vibes in the evening because of the lower lighting but ‚Ä¶

text: Great tacos, not too expensive. Fast and easy service. I came on a Friday around 12:30 and there was only one other table eating, though someone else came in for a pick up order. I got the pulled chicken tacos and the amount of meat per taco was good. They must get busier in the evening. Either way it‚Äôs definitely worth stopping by!

text: Ordered a chicken burrito and shrimp quesadilla for delivery - the quesadilla was almost completely flat with almost no filling, and the burrito was all rice with maybe 3 little chicken cubes. Would expect much more for $20 each. Definitely will not be ordering again.

author: RamO Rivera
text: I loved this place, very cozy and the employees are super friendly and attentive if you need anything. Something that for me is a plus is that the owner approached each table to verify that everything is fine and welcome each customer. ‚Ä¶

author: Valeria Cruz
text:
My whole experience was a 15/10
I sat outside with my dog and the waiter greeted us and my pup with water right away. The staff was all so attentive and so nice. I had an appetizer, a torta, a cocktail and dessert. Every single item ordered was PHENOMENAL. I will be coming back regularly.

author: Nicole Louie
text: Friendly staff and great food. We started with guac and chips which were a no brainer appetizer for us. Then we shared birria tacos before eating our own birria burrito and chorizo papas burrito. Everything we had was great and I loved the portion sizes!

author: Jairo Melara
text:
The food was great. Flavors and portions were ok point.
My only issue was the server. She was dressed like she just got out of bed and was playing with dogs and serving food without washing her hands.

author: Local Everyday
text: Can a great operation be extraordinary in only a couple of details? I think not. That‚Äôs why I am giving 5 stars here. My specific experience tonight is one cocktail and one appetizer. But both are write-home-about good. I have a bit of ‚Ä¶

author: Ellie H
text: Great outdoor seating to bring your dog in the neighborhood. Delicious margaritas and food is good. I love that the outdoor floors are clean and my dog can lay down comfortably while we enjoy happy hour and nice weather. Great atmosphere to wind down after work.

text: We had been searching for a go-to Vietnamese place ahead of winter pho season and boy did we not have to look very far! Plum went above and beyond on all accounts. The plum platter appetizer was a must, especially if you‚Äôre bringing ‚Ä¶

author: Latoya McCalla
text: Stop by on a Sunday afternoon as I was in the area. Cute little place, intimate, has bar seatng as well. Hostess was very nice. I was able to sit immediately with no reservation. I decided to start with the ginger ale, the crispy spring ‚Ä¶

text:
Plum is such a little gem in the upper west side neighborhood.
Perfect spot when I‚Äôm craving pho or just want something cozy.
Love grabbing a sake pineapple or iced Viet coffee, and their duck curry with lychee is a must every time.highly recommend!

author: Zachary Thomas
text:
Very friendly staff and fast service, but ....
‚Ä¢ Pho portion is pretty smol üò≠

text: this AYCE KBBQ spot is now part of my family‚Äôs rotation. the meat is always good and we love that they‚Äôre adding new items to the menu. we always get the cube steak, cast iron steak, pork belly and pork jowl. the staff cooks and cuts the ‚Ä¶

text:
First time coming to Cast Iron Pot!!

A nice place to have gathering either with friends or family to enjoy a nice meal.  Better not to order too much side dishes.

text:
Stopped for dinner as wifey loves tacos, we‚Äôve never been, and it was nearby.

author: zhang yan
text: Very delicious food, the waiters did a great job. The environment is very comfortable.

text: The food and service were great! Got here as soon as they opened and it was nice and quiet and not crowded. I was surprised by the high quality food and freshness as well! Everything was delicious and was as good as dim sum I‚Äôve had in Hong Kong!

text: Great dimsum and service, this is an awesome place for a group dinner in the East village. They execute really well on classic dim sum dishes like BBQ pork buns, scallion pancakes, radish cake and shrimp rice roll. We also loved the ‚Ä¶

text: Don't let the name Dim Sum Palace fool you, they can do more than just dim sum.  We had a lovely Xmas Eve dinner, steamed grouper fish, ginger & scallion crab, fried rice and eggplants for 4 people. ‚Ä¶

text: I came here for dinner recently and thought that it was alright. The interior of the restaurant consists of an omakase bar in the back and a cocktail bar at the front. As we did the 11-course omakase, we were seated at the cocktail bar (the ‚Ä¶

text: There were two great things about this place: the waitress was incredibly gracious and she tries really hard, and there were many other diners who were attractive looking people in beautiful clothes. ‚Ä¶

text: Loved the Omakase experience at the counter and our sushi chef Ryan! It was exceptional! My personal favorite was the tuna with a hazelnut inside with mushrooms on top. The miso black cod with rice on the side as an appetizer is a close ‚Ä¶

The black cod with miso and rice as an appetizer was a close second. They are very punctual, but that's part of the experience, as all the dishes arrive on time.
